properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual country music festival in Tamworth from Friday 13 January until Sunday 22 January.

Road closures will be in place for the event between Saturday 7 January and Tuesday 24 January to accommodate the event, as follows:

  • Peel St between White St and Brisbane St closed from 4am Thursday 12 January until 7pm Monday 23 January
  • Fitzroy St between Smith Pl egress and Peel St closed from 5am Tuesday 10 January until 7pm Tuesday 24 January
  • Fitzroy St between Peel St and Kable Ave closed from 11pm Saturday 7 January until 7pm on Tuesday 24 January
  • Kable Ave between Brisbane St and south of Fitzroy St closed from 5am Wednesday 11 January until noon Tuesday 24 January

Motorists travelling in the area during the festival should be aware of changed access conditions and follow the direction of traffic controllers and police on site. Motorists may experience minor delays on highways in the area.

The Guyra Lamb and Potato festival runs from Wednesday 11 to Monday 23 January 2023.

There are stalls and small shows over the course of the event.

Changed traffic conditions are in place on The New England Highway through Guyra including a reduced speed limit of 40km/h.

There will be higher than usual pedestrian activity around the area during the event so motorists are advised to exercise caution, reduce speed and follow the direction of signage in place.

Australia Day at Parramatta Park from 6am to 12pm midday

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr for Australia Day celebrations.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

Illawarra Folk Festival 2023 at Bulli Showgrounds from Friday 20 to Sunday.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on approach to Bulli Showgrounds particularly at the Grevillea Park Rd intersection from the Princes Hwy.

Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

NBL Sydney Kings v NZ Breakers at Qudos Bank Arena. Tip off from 3:45pm, finish around 6pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the eve.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Newcastle Jets v Western Sydney Wanderers at McDonald Jones Stadium. Start 3pm, finish approx 5pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.B

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend Lunar New Year celebrations along Forest Rd in Hurstville from 12pm to 9pm.

Motorists are advised to allow additional travel time as traffic will be heavier than usual on roads in the area including King Georges Rd, Queens Rd and Railway Pde during the event. 

The following roads will be closed from 1am to 11.30pm:

  • Forest Rd between Woodville St and Treacy St (Eastbound lanes)
  • Forest Rd between Macmahon St and Woodville St (Eastbound lanes)
  • Macmahon St between Forest Rd and Dora St (Southbound lanes)

Special event clearways will be in effect on the following roads from 7am to 4pm:

  • Forest Rd between Gloucester Rd and Bridge St (Both Sides)
  • Queens Rd between Park Rd and The Avenue (Both Sides)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits and TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. Check signs carefully on the day and the night before, as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

Australia Day 2023  - What's On in Sydney

properties.publicTransport: Ferries will be affected during the day and in the evening due to exclusion zones on the harbour. Buses will also be diverting and using different stops due to road closures. Visit transportnsw.info for details.

properties.otherAdvice:
Roads around Circular Quay and The Rocks will close during the day and evening for Australia Day events in the city and around the harbour.

Key road closure timings:

  • 4am to midnight: George St from Essex St to Lower Fort St, Hickson Rd from George St to Pottinger St and sections of Essex St and Circular Quay West.
  • 7am to 10am: Hickson Rd from Napoleon St to Pottinger St, Towns Pl from Dalgety Rd to Hickson Rd, and Barton St (for Oz Day 10K wheelchair race).
  • 7.30pm to 10.30pm: Cahill Expressway lanes 7 & 8 and Overpass at Circular Quay including the High St, Mount St and Domain Tunnel on-ramps and lane 4 on the Harbour Bridge. Roads in Circular Quay north of Bridge St including sections of Albert St, Alfred St, Circular Quay East, Dalley St, Essex St, George St, Loftus St, Pitt St, Philip St, Macquarie St, Reiby Place, Underwood St and Young St. 

The speed limit on the Harbour Bridge will be reduced to 40km/h from 8pm to 9.30pm.

The Cahill Expressway overpass walkway will be closed from 5pm to 9:30pm. The Sydney Harbour Bridge Walkway and Cycleway will remain open.

Special event clearways will be in effect on various roads in Circular Quay and The Rocks from 3am until midnight with additional clearways in place throughout the city on various roads between Circular Quay and Martin Place from 5pm until 10.30pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits and Mobility Scheme permit holders. Check signs carefully on the day and the night before, as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.html:

properties.otherAdvice:
Cliff Road will be closed between Harbour Street and Georges Place for the Wollongong Aquathon, Australia's biggest swim-run event, on Australia Day. The road closure will be in place from 6am until 12pm.

Motorists will be detoured via Corrimal Street. Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in effect on Macquarie St in the Sydney CBD for a 24 hour arts & culture festival, Mopoke Sydney, starting from 6pm Saturday 4 to 6pm Sunday 5 February.

Macquarie St will be closed between Hunter St and Prince Albert Rd from 6am Sat 4 Feb until 11:59pm Sun 5 Feb. Motorists will be detoured via Elizabeth St.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 5am Sat 4 Feb until 11:59pm Sun 5 Feb on the western side of Macquarie St from Prince Albert Rd to Hunter St. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even for local residents or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in event tickets. Light rail services and buses run frequently to Moore Park so leave the car at home. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney 7's at Allianz Stadium. Gates open Friday 11:30am. Gates open Saturday and Sunday 8:45am. Finish each night approx 9pm.

Large crowds are expected each day and traffic will be heavy over the weekend on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium each day and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the concert.

Access EP2 Kippax car park from Moore Park Rd, or from the Eastern Distributor use the Bondi exit. Access EP3 southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd, from the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit.


Special event clearways are in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to 10pm on Friday 27 January and from 8am to 11pm on Saturday 28 and Sunday 29 on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies

FRIDAY 27 JANUARY FROM 3PM TO 10PM AND SATURDAY 28 & SUNDAY 29 JANUARY FROM 8AM TO 11PM

  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the eve.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.B

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.otherAdvice:
Expressway Stakes Day Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. Gates Open: 11:30am First race at 12:25pm, last race at 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Western Sydney Wanderers. Game starts at 7:45pm, finish around 9:30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St before the match and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area

SummerSalt festival at Thomas Dalton Park, Fairy Meadow. Start at 12:30pm. Finish approx 9:15pm

Carters Ln will be closed from Elliotts Rd to Dixon St and Pioneer Rd will be a one-way street northbound to Edgar St during the concert.

Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and follow the direct of traffic controllers onsite. Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian movement.

By The C festival at Thomas Dalton Park, Fairy Meadow. Start at 12pm midday. Finish approx 8:45pm

Carters Ln will be closed from Elliotts Rd to Dixon St and Pioneer Rd will be a one-way street northbound to Edgar St during the concert.

Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and follow the direct of traffic controllers onsite. Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian movement.

NBL: Sydney Kings v South East Melbourne Phoenix at Qudos Bank Arena. Start 3:45pm. Finish approx 6pm

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the eve.

properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Sun Run 7km and 10km fun run events will start from 6:15am from The Strand in Dee Why and finish by 9:30am at South Steyne in Manly. Road closures, parking restrictions and changed traffic conditions will be in effect. All roads will re-open by 11am. 

Residents along the course are urged to plan ahead and relocate their vehicles outside the road closure footprint if vehicle access is required on event day. There will be limited vehicle movements permitted while the event is underway. 

Road closures:

  • Dee Why - 3.30am to 9am: sections of Howard Ave, The Strand and Dee Why Pde. Crossover maintained on Oaks Ave at The Strand eastbound until 5:15am and westbound until 6am. 
  • Curl Curl to Freshwater - 5:30am to 9am: Griffin Rd, Pitt Rd, Abbott Rd, Carrington Pde and local surrounding roads will be closed. Crossover maintained on Griffin Rd at Pacific Pde in both directions and on Playfair Rd, Ross Rd at Pitt Rd until 6am. 
  • Queenscliff - 5.30am to 10am: sections of Undercliff Rd, Dalley St, Greycliffe St, Queenscliff Rd, Dowling St, Lumsdaine Dr and surrounding local roads. Crossover maintained westbound (exit only) on Crowd Rd between Dowling St and Cavill St from 5:30am-6:15am and 9am-10am. 
  • Manly - 3.30am to 9:30am: sections of North Steyne, Raglan St, Collingwood St and other local roads. Managed access for Cameron Ave residents from 5.30am-9am.
  • Manly - 3.30am to 11am: sections of South Steyne, Wentworth St, Ashburner St and Victoria Pde.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 3am until 9am along sections of roads in Dee Why, North Curl Curl, Freshwater, Queenscliff and Manly including sections of Abbott Rd, Howard Ave, The Strand, Evans St, Crown Rd and North Steyne. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even for local residents or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, use the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
Vehicle cross over points have been established to facilitate resident access where possible. To ensure the safety of runners, these points will be closed to vehicles whilst runners pass through. During this time there will be no vehicle access from the following areas.

Dee Why and North Curl Curl - residents between the course and the coastline no access while crossovers closed

Curl Curl and Freshwater - residents of cul-de sac roads off the western side of the course no access until roads reopen

  • Dee Why The Strand at Oaks Ave crossover eastbound 5:15am â€“ 7:15am
  • Dee Why The Strand at Oaks Ave crossover westbound 6:00am â€“ 7:15am
  • Dee Why Griffin Rd at Pacific Pde crossover both directions 6:00am â€“ 7:30am
  • North Curl Curl Griffin Rd at Headland Rd crossover both directions 6:00am â€“ 7:30am
  • North Curl Curl Pitt Rd at Playfair Rd crossover both directions 6:00am â€“ 8:00am
  • North Curl Curl Pitt Rd Ross St > Pitt Rd > Playfair Rd and vice versa crossover both directions 6:00am â€“ 8:00am

Queenscliff and Freshwater - residents between the course and the coastline no access while crossover closed

  • Queenscliff Crown Rd between Dowling St and Cavill St, managed exit westbound only from 5:30am - 6:15am and 9am - 10am, crossover closed 6:15am â€“ 9am.

Manly

  • Managed access to/from Cameron Ave via Collingwood St only 5:30am-9:30am

properties.otherAdvice:
The New England Highway between John and King Street will be closed for approximately two hours on Thursday 26 January to allow for an Australia Day procession. The road will be closed from 10am with a short detour in place.

Motorists are asked to follow the direction of signage and watch for pedestrians.
properties.diversions:
Temporary detour via Kings Street, Maitland Street and John Street.

Follow the direction of detour signage.

webLinks.linkText: NSW National Parks & Wildlife Service - Royal National Park local alerts

properties.otherAdvice:
The Royal National Park is expected to be busy on Australia Day, Thursday 26 January and over the weekend.

Road closures will be implemented as precincts and car parks reach full at Wattamolla Beach, Garie Beach, Audley, Maianbar, and Bundeena.

If parking capacity is reached across all precincts, traffic will only be permitted to travel through the park. If there are significant delays, both the northern and southern entries to the park, via Farnell Ave at Loftus and via Lady Wakehurst Dr at Otford, will close. Entry will be maintained via McKell Ave at Waterfall for residents only. 

Visitors are encouraged to check the Royal National Park local alerts before travelling for updates on precinct access. Walking trails may also be closed due to fire bans and/or risks so plan ahead. 

Road closures when precincts reach capacity:

  • Wattamolla Rd between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Wattamolla Beach
  • Maianbar Rd between Bundeena Dr and Maianbar township
  • Bundeena Dr between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Bundeena township

Traffic controllers and NSW Police will be managing access for local residents, upon proof of address, at Maianbar Rd and Bundeena Dr.

Note - Garie Rd remains closed from Sir Bertram Stevens Dr due to earlier road damage.
properties.displayName: Royal National Park - Australia Day holiday period

roads.mainStreet: McKell Ave, Farnell Ave and various roads

properties.otherAdvice:
Gosford Australia Day event will be held between 4pm and 9pm on Thursday 26 January 2023 in the Gosford Leagues Club car park.

There will be a 40km/h speed reduction in place on the Central Coast Highway around the McGowan Bridge. There will be increased pedestrian activity in the area and motorists are reminded to exercise caution and take extra care.

Local road closures and detours will also be in place.
properties.diversions: Local roads impacted include - Georgiana Terrace, Barker Street, Vaughan Avenue and Dane Drive. Please follow detour signage.

properties.otherAdvice:
Lake Mac Festival will be held at Thomas Halton Park, Croudace Bay from 8am Saturday 28 to 5pm Sunday 29 January.

A 40km/h speed limit will be in place around the event area and increased pedestrian activity is expected so motorists are reminded to follow signage and exercise caution.

Road shoulder closures will be in place on Bareki Road for the safety of motorists and pedestrians.

Royal Randwick Race day. First race from 12:25pm, last race at 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd.

Motorists should allow extra time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Illawarra Hawks v Brisbane Bullets. Tip-off from 5:30pm, finish around 7pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Sydney Symphony Under the Stars at Parramatta Park from 8pm to 9:30pm

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as music fans travel to this event.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in tickets to the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park Game Day Clearway Map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: Moore Park Game Day Clearway Map.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park Game Day Clearway Map

properties.otherAdvice:
BBL: Sydney Sixers v Sydney Thunder at the Sydney Cricket Ground. Gates Open: 5.05pm, Start: 7.05pm, Finish: 10.05pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park on Saturday evening including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd

Driver Ave will be partially closed from 4pm outside the stadium before the match starts and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP2 northern grass car park from Moore Park Rd, and from the Eastern Distributor use the Bondi exit. Access EP3 southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd, or from the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until midnight including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)

  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney Sydney Lunar Streets event in Haymarket. The event runs from 5pm until 10pm. 

  • Hay St will be closed in both directions between Sussex St and Harbour St from 12pm Saturday 21 until 1am Sunday 22 January
  • Sections of Harbour St, Sussex St, Little Hay St, Factory St, Kimber Ln and Little Pier St will also be closed during this time.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 10am Saturday 21 until 1am Sunday 22 January on sections of Hay St, Harbour St, Sussex St and Little Hay St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits and TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. Check signs carefully on the day and the night before, as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

properties.headline: Special event NORTH SYDNEY TO SYDNEY CBD Sydney Harbour Bridge - Cahill Expressway Circular Quay Overpass
properties.publicTransport: Buses will start and end trips in North Sydney or in the Sydney CBD from 3am to 10am, catch trains across the bridge to continue your trip. Visit transportnsw.info to plan ahead.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Sydney Harbour Bridge road closure and clearway map - 22 Jan 2023
arrangementAttachments.fileName: Sydney Harbour Bridge road closure and clearway map - 22 Jan 2023.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Sydney Harbour Bridge road closure and clearway map - 22 Jan 2023
arrangementAttachments.uniqueFileName: 599908_1673409703509_Sydney Harbour Bridge road closure and clearway map - 22 Jan 2023.pdf

properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Harbour Bridge is due be closed in both directions from 3am to 10am to facilitate filming.

The Sydney Harbour Bridge cycleway and footpath will be closed from 5.30am to 10am. The Cahill Expressway walkway will be closed from 2.30am to 12.30pm. 

Roads beneath the Sydney Harbour Bridge in Dawes Point and Milsons Point/Kirribilli including sections of Hickson Rd and Olympic Dr, Alfred St and Broughton St will be closed from 5.30am to 10am with managed access.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect in North Sydney from 3am to 10am on sections of the Pacific Highway. In the Sydney CBD, clearways will be in effect from 6am to 10am on key roads including Bathurst St, Elizabeth St, King St, Park St, Riley St, St James Rd, Sussex St, William St, Clarence St and York St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even for local residents or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, use the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:

FROM 2:00AM TO 1:00PM

  • Burton Street between Alfred Street South and Broughton Street

 FROM 3:00AM TO 10:00AM

SYDNEY HARBOUR BRIDGE - ALL RAMPS AND APPROACHES

FROM 3:00AM TO 10:00AM

  • Bradfield Highway (Sydney Harbour Bridge) Lanes 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6
  • Cahill Expressway (Sydney Harbour Bridge) Lanes 7 and 8
  • Pacific Highway between Bradfield Highway and High Street

  • Warringah Freeway all access ramps and lanes to/from Sydney Harbour Bridge

WESTERN DISTRIBUTOR

From 3am to 10am connecting ramps between the Western Distributor and Sydney Harbour Bridge will be closed. Access will be maintained to Sydney CBD via ANZAC Bridge and the Pyrmont Street and Fig Street on ramps, exiting to the Bathurst Street and King Street off ramps.

Western Distributor access to King Street Wharf - Motorists will be able to access King Street Wharf precinct via Erskine Street and Wheat Road.

Wheat Road approaches:

  • from the Western Distributor - Bathurst Street exit: left via the slip lane onto the Western Distributor then left into Wheat Road. No access to Sydney Harbour Bridge.
  • from Harbour Street northbound at Bathurst Street: managed access straight ahead then left into Wheat Road. No access to Sydney Harbour Bridge

Western Distributor closures

  • Anzac Bridge on ramp1 from Darling Harbour overpass
  • Cross City Tunnel exit2 to Harbour Street / CBD North Northbound
  • Western Distributor3 between Bathurst Street and Bradfield Highway Northbound
  • Sydney Harbour Bridge southern on-ramp between Grosvenor Street and Bradfield Hwy Northbound
  • Harbour Street between Bathurst Street and Western Distributor on-ramp to Harbour Bridge
  • Western Distributor between Bradfield Highway and Blackwattle Place Southbound

Notes

1 Traffic will be detoured to the King Street off ramp into Sydney CBD.

2 The Cross City Tunnel exit southbound to Bathurst Street will remain open.

3 Managed access available to Wheat Road for King Street Wharf and Barangaroo South precincts.

 

THE ROCKS

FROM 5:30AM TO 10:00AM

  • Hickson Road* between Pottinger Street and Pier One
  • Hickson Road between OPT Elevated Road and Park Hyatt
  • Lower Fort Street at George Street

Notes:

Managed access to Pier One and Park Hyatt Hotels only


Walkway and Cycleway closures

  • Sydney Harbour Bridge cycleway and walkway closed in both directions from 5.30am to 10am
  • Cahill Expressway walkway over Circular Quay closed from 2.30am to 12.30pm

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on the following roads listed below. These clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

  • Pacific Highway between Berry Street and Walker Street (Authorised Route Buses Excepted - Eastern side)

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

properties.diversions:
Southbound traffic on the Cahill Expressway between 1am and 3am, and between 10am and 12.30pm will be diverted via York St – motorists can join the Eastern Distributor via Shakespeare Place. Northbound traffic can access the Harbour Bridge via Macquarie St, Bridge St and Grosvenor St.

While the Harbour Bridge is closed use the Sydney Harbour Tunnel or Victoria Rd and Gladesville Bridge.

Citybound traffic from the Anzac Bridge will be detoured via Bathurst St off-ramp and all traffic accessing the Western Distributor from Fig St and Pyrmont St will be detoured via King St off-ramp.
